title: Apply Tactical tab visual styling and animations across all tabs

requirements.text: Update the BASICS, MEDICAL, INFO, UTILITIES, WEAPONS, and SETTINGS tabs to use the same visual styling as the TACTICAL tab by reusing the existing Tactical tab CSS patterns (e.g., `.tactical-panel`, bordered/inset-glow panel look, textured panel background, and dense HUD typography) for their primary panels and sections.

quotes: everything  except tactics is still so bland. make it more visually appealing like the tactics tab

acceptanceCriteria: Each non-tactical tab renders its main content inside card/panel containers that visually match the Tactical tab panels (border weight, glow, texture, and overall density).
The updated non-tactical tabs no longer appear as mostly-unstyled content blocks; they present information as structured, Tactical-style panels/sections.
No user-facing text is changed away from English.

requirements.text: Apply the same interaction polish used in the Tactical tab (hover states, subtle transitions, and emphasis effects such as glow/pulse where appropriate) to comparable interactive elements in all other tabs (e.g., list rows, toggles, buttons, and panel sub-rows) while preserving existing functionality.

quotes: everything  except tactics is still so bland. make it more visually appealing like the tactics tab

acceptanceCriteria: Interactive rows and controls in non-tactical tabs have visible hover/focus/active feedback comparable in intensity and style to Tactical tab elements (e.g., border-color shift, background tint, transition).

Any existing animations already present in the codebase for the Tactical tab (e.g., pulse/glow emphasis patterns) are reused consistently where they make sense in other tabs, without introducing distracting motion.
All existing click/toggle behaviors, audio cues, and store updates continue to work as before.

requirements.text: Standardize tab content layout spacing and scrolling so that all tabs follow the Tactical tab content container conventions (padding scaled by `--hud-scale`, consistent internal gaps, and predictable overflow behavior) across STANDARD and TACTICAL display modes.

quotes: make it more visually appealing like the tactics tab

acceptanceCriteria: All tabs have consistent outer padding and spacing rules comparable to `.tactical-tab` (scaled padding, consistent section gaps).
In both STANDARD and TACTICAL display modes, tab content remains usable (no clipped content; scrolling works where needed).
The TACTICAL tab visibility/behavior remains unchanged (still conditional on Tactical Mode being enabled).

constraints: Do not modify any files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (Shadcn components are read-only).
Keep the backend architecture unchanged (single Motoko actor); this request is UI-only unless a UI dependency is discovered.
nonGoals: Do not add new tabs, new backend features, or new domain functionality (this is a visual/UX polish pass only).
Do not change the Tactical Mode toggle logic or the conditional visibility of the TACTICAL tab.
Do not replace the overall HUD/CRT aesthetic; only propagate the Tactical tabâ€™s existing look and motion patterns to the other tabs.

preferencesToAdd: Use the exact Tactical tab visual style and animations for all tabs.
